bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 173 (Thursday, October 31, 2019)][House][Pages H8720-H8721]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WEXTON:H.R. 4971.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, clause 7By Miss. recordedVote.fullActionName: Final Passage Under Suspension of the Rules Results

item.latestTitle: Improving Benefits for Underserved Veterans Act

To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish and implement a comprehensive anti-harassment and anti-sexual assault policy of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

item.latestTitle: Women Veterans Health Care Accountability Act
Caring For Our Women Veterans Act
Supporting Veteran Survivors of Domestic and Sexual Violence Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

item.latestTitle: Improving Legal Services for Female Veterans Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.

item.latestTitle: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to submit to Congress a report on the availability of prosthetic items for women veterans from the Department of Veterans Affairs.
Building Supportive Networks for Women Veterans Act
To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to improve the communications of the Department of Veterans Affairs relating to services available for women veterans, and for other purposes.

item.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 399 - 11 (Roll no. 611). (text: CR H8763-8769)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 399 - 11 (Roll no. 611).(text: CR H8763-8769)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H8774-8775)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3224.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H8763-8773)
Mr. Takano moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 226.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 116-281.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 116-281.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Health Discharged.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Introduced in House
Introduced in House

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]
Rep. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]

item.text: This bill requires the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to ensure that gender-specific services are continuously available at every VA medical center and community-based outpatient clinic. Additionally, the VA must conduct a study, interviewing women veterans and employees, to assess the need for and use of extended hours as a means of reducing barriers to care.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Deborah Sampson Act

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Deborah Sampson Act
To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for increased access to Department of Veterans Affairs medical care for women veterans.

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
